Name: Good Hope Plantation Rum Punch
Ingredients: 20 ml Jamaican-style overproof aged pot still rum
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Double old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of skewered lime slice wheel and Luxardo Maraschino Cherry (sail) with mint sprigs.
TOP with soda and briefly stir.
Garnish with skewered lime slice wheel and maraschino cherry (sail) with mint sprigs bouquet.
Review: A classic rum and citrus-laced, generously flavoured, single-serve punch.
History: Originally made at the Good Hope Hotel in Falmouth, Jamaica. The Good Hope is an 18th Century country house set in a 2,000-acre plantation high in the lush landscape of Cockpit Country near Montego Bay.
Nutrition: One serving of Good Hope Plantation Rum Punch contains 172 calories
